channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Nearly 80 percent of Māori military personnel have PTSD symptoms
item.description: A study on serving or retired NZ military personnel has revealed alarming rates of PTSD symptoms - including 78 percent of Māori assessed.

item.title: Govt announces $40m funding for mental health service
item.description: The government is funding the further roll out of free mental health and addiction services across the country.

item.title: Anzac Day 2020 Live updates: Stand at dawn
item.description: Anzac Day commemorations are different this year due to Covid-19. Join RNZ for our coverage.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in New Zealand on 24 April
item.description: The last weekend in level 4 lockdown is here and NZers are looking to the future, with businesses getting ready to resume, and research on anti-viral drugs continuing.

item.title: Watch RNZ's livestream of Anzac Day commemorations
item.description: RNZ has partnered with the RSA and the NZDF to broadcast a special Dawn Service - you can watch it here.

item.title: Kiwis commemorate Anzac day under lockdown rules
item.description: New Zealanders are commemorating Anzac Day all around the country today, despite the impact of Covid-19.

item.title: Blended families describe how kids, relationships impacted by lockdown
item.description: Broken bubbles, breached family court orders and children who haven't seen their parents in weeks - that's life in lockdown for many families with shared childcare arrangements.

item.title: Man arrested after coughing and sneezing on woman
item.description: A man has been arrested after he was reportedly followed a woman around an Auckland city supermarket, deliberately and repeatedly coughing and sneezing on her.

item.title: Ōtara locals band together to help vulnerable neighbours
item.description: The Covid-19 lockdown has been hard on everyone, but few have felt the pressure more keenly than the people of Ōtara.

item.title: Covid-19: Five new cases of Covid-19 in NZ, one further death
item.description: There have been five new cases of Covid-19 in the past 24 hours, with one more death linked to the Rosewood Rest Home cluster. Watch the latest media briefing here.

item.title: Finch Street residents get into the spirit of lockdown
item.description: Residents from one Auckland street have collaborated to create a special momento of life in their neighbourhood during lockdown.

item.title: Kids called upon to monitor carbon emissions during lockdown
item.description: Scientists are calling on kids to collect samples of grass for 10 weeks from within their neighbourhood bubble and store them in their freezer.

item.title: Anzac Day activities to do with kids at home
item.description: From poppy art, educational videos, competitions, and baking - take inspiration from these Anzac activities to do during lockdown this year.

item.title: Survey to stocktake biodiversity in cities starts today
item.description: A survey to stocktake biodiversity in cities starts today with Auckland, Christchurch and Dunedin taking part in the citizen science project.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates from NZ and around the world
item.description: Police are urging NZers not to relax restrictions over the Anzac weekend, with checkpoints operating at holiday hot spots. See how the rest of the day's news unfolded with RNZ's blog.

item.title: Covid-19 lockdown: Nearly 30,000 more people on jobseeker benefit
item.description: In the four weeks since it was announced the country was going into lockdown, 33,000 more people have ended up on the benefit.

item.title: Covid-19: New Zealanders 'counting the days' until drop to level 3
item.description: New Zealanders are gearing up to make the most of the move to Covid-19 alert level 3.

item.title: Police officer who raped colleague in Northland named
item.description: A police officer who raped his colleague in Northland last year can now be named.
